name: 曾祥森
objective:
OUTLINES
This course aims at developing comprehension of derivation and integral、activating capabilities of logic inference and induction、enlightening confidence and independence、strengthening calculating abilities with an emphasis on its application and diagram、furnishing a sound basis for future specialty. The content of Calculus(II) includes: 
1. Indefinite and Definite Integral, 2. Techniques of Integration, 3. Application of Integration, 4. Parametric Equations and Polar Coordinates 5. Basic Vector Analysis, 6. Partial Derivative, 7. Multiple Integration, 8. Infinite Series.
schedule:
SYLLABUS
Week 1 ---Indefinite integrals and basic formulas
Week 2 ---The definite integral, Evaluating definite integrals
Week 3 ---Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, Substitution rule
Week 4 ---Integration by parts, Trigonometric integrals  (First Test)
Week 5 ---Partial fractions, Other substitutions, Improper integrals
Week 6 ---Areas between curves, Volumes of solids of revolution
Week 7 ---Volume by cylindrical shell, Arc length of curves
Week 8 ---Review for midterm exam
Week 9 ---Midterm exam
Week 10 –Calculus with parametric curves, Polar coordinates
Week 11 –Three-dimensional , Vector functions, Lines and planes
Week 12 –Functions of several variables, Partial derivatives
Week 13 –The chain rule, Directional derivatives and the gradient,
         Extreme values of functions of two variables
Week 14 –Double integrals, Applications of double integrals  (Second Test)
Week 15 –Triple integrals, Change of variables in multiple integrals
Week 16 –Infinite series, Power series, Taylor and Maclaurin series
Week 17 –Review for final exam
Week 18 –Final exam
scorePolicy:
GRADE
1. Homework 20%
2. Tests(2) 30%
3. Midterm exam 20%
4. Final exam 30%
